documentation.text:
The interface through which solidity contracts will interact with Parachain Staking
 We follow this same interface including four-byte function selectors, in the precompile that
 wraps the pallet
Check whether the specified address is currently a staking nominator
Check whether the specified addess is currently a collator candidate
Check whether the specifies address is currently a part of the active set
Total points awarded to all collators in a particular round.
Get the minimum nomination amount
Join the set of collator candidates

Request to leave the set of candidates. If successful, the account is immediately
 removed from the candidate pool to prevent selection as a collator, but unbonding is
 executed with a delay of `BondDuration` rounds.
Temporarily leave the set of collator candidates without unbonding
Rejoin the set of collator candidates if previously had called `go_offline`
Bond more for collator candidates
Bond less for collator candidates

If caller is not a nominator, then join the set of nominators
 If caller is a nominator, then makes nomination to change their nomination state
Leave the set of nominators and, by implication, revoke all ongoing nominations
Revoke an existing nomination
Bond more for nominators with respect to a specific collator candidate
Bond less for nominators with respect to a specific nominator candidate

The interface through which solidity contracts will interact with Parachain Staking
 We follow this same interface including four-byte function selectors, in the precompile that
 wraps the pallet
Check whether the specified address is currently a staking nominator
Check whether the specified addess is currently a collator candidate
Check whether the specifies address is currently a part of the active set
Total points awarded to all collators in a particular round.
Get the minimum nomination amount
Join the set of collator candidates

Request to leave the set of candidates. If successful, the account is immediately
 removed from the candidate pool to prevent selection as a collator, but unbonding is
 executed with a delay of `BondDuration` rounds.
Temporarily leave the set of collator candidates without unbonding
Rejoin the set of collator candidates if previously had called `go_offline`
Bond more for collator candidates
Bond less for collator candidates

If caller is not a nominator, then join the set of nominators
 If caller is a nominator, then makes nomination to change their nomination state
Leave the set of nominators and, by implication, revoke all ongoing nominations
Revoke an existing nomination
Bond more for nominators with respect to a specific collator candidate
Bond less for nominators with respect to a specific nominator candidate

go_offline().notice: Temporarily leave the set of collator candidates without unbonding

go_online().notice: Rejoin the set of collator candidates if previously had called `go_offline`

is_candidate(address).notice: Check whether the specified addess is currently a collator candidate

is_nominator(address).notice: Check whether the specified address is currently a staking nominator

is_selected_candidate(address).notice: Check whether the specifies address is currently a part of the active set

join_candidates(uint256,uint256).notice: Join the set of collator candidates

leave_candidates(uint256,uint256).notice: Request to leave the set of candidates. If successful, the account is immediately removed from the candidate pool to prevent selection as a collator, but unbonding is executed with a delay of `BondDuration` rounds.

leave_nominators(uint256).notice: Leave the set of nominators and, by implication, revoke all ongoing nominations

nominate(address,uint256,uint256,uint256.notice: If caller is not a nominator, then join the set of nominators If caller is a nominator, then makes nomination to change their nomination state

nominator_bond_less(address,uint256).notice: Bond less for nominators with respect to a specific nominator candidate

nominator_bond_more(address,uint256).notice: Bond more for nominators with respect to a specific collator candidate

points(uint256).notice: Total points awarded to all collators in a particular round.

userdoc.notice: The interface through which solidity contracts will interact with Parachain Staking We follow this same interface including four-byte function selectors, in the precompile that wraps the pallet
